paragraphs.content: A data type specifies the type of data that is being stored in a variable. In Java, as it is a strongly typed language, all variables must have a specified data type.
Integer data types store numeric whole numbers (without a decimal).

A byte is used for a really smaller integer between -128 and 127. Many programmers use this when they are sure the variable stored as a byte will not exceed the maximum byte values. This is generally used to save memory, therefore increasing efficiency.
A short can store integers larger than a byte but smaller than an int. It can store integers between -32768 and 32767.

An int is the most commonly used data type for storing integers. It can store integers between -2147483648 and 2147483647 (Pretty large!). Most Java programmers use this when storing any integer type variable.

A long can store extremely large integers (between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807). This is only used in the rare occasion that an int is too small to store an integer. The value should end with an 'L' when stored as a long.

openChoiceQuiz.question: What is the most commonly used integer data type?
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! The int data type is used for most data which are integers. This is because it is the perfect middle ground in terms of how big the integer limit is.
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The answer is int. The int data type is used for most data which are integers. This is because it is the perfect middle ground in terms of how big the integer limit is.

trueFalseQuiz.question: True or false: The largest data type to store an integer is int.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! Int is the second largest.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The largest is in fact long, with int being the second largest.

multipleChoiceQuiz.question: What integer data type would most efficiently store the number '3', which will not change?
multipleChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! 3 is a small number and because it is not going to change, it should be stored as a byte as we are sure it won't increase the limits of a byte.
multipleChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The answer is byte. You could store it in this data type however, it is not efficient. Also, as the data won't change, we can be sure it won't reach the limits of a byte.

multipleChoiceQuiz.question: What integer data type would most efficiently store the number '25,000', which will change?
multipleChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! Although this number can be stored as a short, it won't be right to do so as it is subject to change (variable), so it may reach the limits of a short.
multipleChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The answer is int. A long can also be used but because the likelihood of the number exceeding the limits of an int would be very unlikely, an int is more appropiate and efficient. Although this number can be stored as a short, it won't be right to do so as it is subject to change (variable), so it may reach the limits of a short.
